title: 114_hr2225
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Prioritizing Reinvestment in Infrastructure and Military while Eliminating Debt Act of 2015" or the "PRIMED Act". It includes a provision for a dividends received deduction for repatriated foreign earnings. The Prioritizing Reinvestment in Infrastructure and Military while Eliminating Debt Act of 2015 allows for a dividends received deduction for repatriated foreign earnings. The amendment specifies that only cash dividends received between the enactment date and December 31, 2016, will be considered. Taxpayers can elect to apply this section to one taxable year that includes this period. The Prioritizing Reinvestment in Infrastructure and Military while Eliminating Debt Act of 2015 allows for a dividends received deduction for repatriated foreign earnings. Amendments to Section 965 of the Internal Revenue Code change the threshold period and indebtedness determination date to June 30, 2014, and May 1, 2015, respectively. These changes apply to taxable years ending after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. DEBT REDUCTION.

In cases where taxes received in the Treasury during a fiscal year without a Federal budget deficit are from eligible 965 dividends received by U.S. corporations, 1/3 of such taxes (minus 1/3 of the foreign tax credit) will be used to reduce the Federal debt.

(b) Definitions.--For purposes of subsection (a), "eligible 965 dividend" and "non-deductible portion" have meanings as defined in section 9503(b)(7) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Section 9503(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to appropriate excess taxes from eligible 965 dividends received by U.S. corporations to the Highway Trust Fund. The term "eligible 965 dividend" refers to amounts received from a controlled foreign corporation with a deduction allowed under section 965. The term "non-deductible portion" is the excess of an eligible 965 dividend over the deductible portion. SEC. 5. ADJUSTMENT TO DEFENSE DISCRETIONARY SPENDING LIMITATIONS. The revised security category in the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 will be adjusted annually from 2016 to 2020 based on specific criteria related to taxes received and foreign tax credits. The non-deductible portion of eligible 965 dividends is defined in section 9503(b)(7) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
